name: Dev Crit, Epic Dodge, BAB 40+, Dev Crit DC 40+
author: Theophilus Fist

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
1) PvM or PvP - Both

2) Level cap - 40

3) Race preference - any

4) Class preference - Open, but I see FTR/COT/SD or BRD/RDD/(SD or ROG)

5) Melee preference - Sword and Board

6) Range preference - DEX archery 

7) Weapon preference - Scimitar

8) Maximum item enhancement - Call it +5

9) Spellcasting - No need

10) Custom factors - Not looking for SC V, just want to kill, then dodge his buddies

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
This is the one that first springs to mind Theo

Tears of the Dragon

Falls a couple of points short in that the Dev Crit DC is 38 and AB is 37 unbuffed but I'm not sure it is possible to get much better.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Essentially this is exactly on the mark, Kalistez, with Curse Song/ Bard Song, even without adding War Cry to the mix, the AB becomes 44 & the DC for Dev. Crit. becomes 40 because of the penalty to the saves for your opponents. You can do this combo enough times a day too.

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content: Yes, I saw him.  Since I wasn't interested in casting Bard spells, etc., I was wondering if there was a version with higher AB.  I'm not sure if this is posible without RDD.  There are a couple BRD/RDD/SD combos with ED and DC, but their ABs are in the 33-35 range.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Well, if you want to  really optimize him, you could start with Elf and 18 DEX/ 18 STR/ 10 CON/ 10 INT/ 8 WIS/ 8 CHA and finish with 30 STR/ 26 DEX/ 12 CON/ 12 INT/ 8 WIS/ 10 CHA, of course you won't be able to cast spells but the Curse Song/ Bard Song remains as is the UMD and everything else. There is your 40 AB/ 40 DC Dev. Crit.

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
I also found this one Shadow Warrior by Mith

Ubuffed DW AB of 38, Dev Crit DC of 38 and HiPS

I know the AB and DC are a bit lower than you wanted (although AB is 40 if you don't DW) but it has HiPS and you don't have spells to worry about.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey Theo, if I may weigh in here, having ED and DC means splitting stats between STR and DEX, which means LOW AB no matter what. Self-buffing might be the only way to raise the AB to acceptable levels. So, why don't you want to cast Bard spells?

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content: My thinking is that the points that go into CHA for spellcasting could go into STR or DEX.  There is generally enough STR boosting gear that Bull's is useless after the early 20s.  Plus, the caster level will be so low that HOTU level monsters can dispel buffs.  Bard Song will give +2 AB.  If 6 from CHA (14 to 8) go into STR (say 15 to 17), that could mean up to 3 more AB down the road, plus increase CON or something else.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Theophilus Fist wrote:
My thinking is that the points that go into CHA for spellcasting could go into STR or DEX.  There is generally enough STR boosting gear that Bull's is useless after the early 20s.  Plus, the caster level will be so low that HOTU level monsters can dispel buffs.  Bard Song will give +2 AB.  If 6 from CHA (14 to 8) go into STR (say 15 to 17), that could mean up to 3 more AB down the road, plus increase CON or something else.
Well, 15 to 17 means 5 stat points. It will technically give you 1 AB (+1 modifier). The Warcry spell alone gives you 2 AB. Now, considering stat buffs, such as Bull's Strength, you can gain +1 or +2 AB more, GMW will give you +5 to AB (neglectible on HoTU, but very useful on non-uber-magic worlds and up to that point too). And when have you ever seen a HoTU monster cast dispel? LOL! They never do! And isn't it great that you only need 14 CHA to cast your spells cuz RDD will GIVE YOU the other 2 to CHA for free? As I see it, it's a win / win situation. Your Warcry is a short duration buff, and with 16 Bard levels, you can extend it at level 6, since you won't have any known spells on that level, but will be able to cast 6th level spells and since you have such high DEX, Arcane Spell Failure can be avoided with a simple unequipping of the shield.

Take it EZ!
